subject: Re: [junit] Counting assertions
msgSnippet: ... Hi Phlip, My reading of this post is that it s a JUnit extension and required a patch to vanilla JUnit. Since it s one of Vladimir s posts, I could
messageBody:
On 15/10/05, Phlip <phlipcpp@...> wrote:
>
> JUniters:
>
> These posts discuss adding a count of assertions to
> each run:
>
> http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/1329


Hi Phlip,
My reading of this post is that it's a JUnit extension and required a patch
to vanilla JUnit. Since it's one of Vladimir's posts, I could speculate that
he might have included it in JUnit-addons or something. I've not been able
to find it myself.

This feature is very useful for a burn-up chart in a
> legacy code situation.
>
> Is this feature in the latest published version and I
> could not find it?
>
> If not, could someone fling me a code snip to get me started?


I think the suggested way to proceed is to provide a custom version of
Assert. You might otherwise by able to do it using an aspect-oriented
approach. This <http://groups.yahoo.com/group/junit/message/12878> thread
discussed an approach for hooking into the assertXXX methods like that.

I don't know how it would work in JUnit version4, since I only started
looking at that today.

James

Phlip
